tips.summary: Move by character with h/j/k/l
tips.details:
h left j down k up l right
Counts work: 5j moves 5 lines

tips.summary: Move by word with w/b/e
tips.details:
w next word start b previous word start e word end
Try: 3w to jump three words

tips.summary: Move by WORD with W/B/E
tips.details:
WORDs are whitespace-separated (punctuation stays with the WORD)
Use when navigating paths or tokens

tips.summary: Jump within a line with 0, ^, and $
tips.details:
0 column 1 ^ first non-blank $ end of line
Use ^ a lot in indented code

tips.summary: Jump to file edges with gg and G
tips.details:
gg first line G last line
Use 42G to jump to line 42

tips.summary: Move to screen top/middle/bottom with H/M/L
tips.details:
H top visible line M middle L bottom
Great for fast viewport navigation

tips.summary: Scroll half a page with Ctrl-d/Ctrl-u
tips.details:
Ctrl-d scroll down half-screen Ctrl-u up half-screen
Cursor position changes with the screen

tips.summary: Scroll without moving the cursor with Ctrl-e/Ctrl-y
tips.details:
Ctrl-e scroll window down one line Ctrl-y up one line
Cursor stays on the same buffer position

tips.summary: Jump by paragraphs with { and }
tips.details:
{ previous paragraph } next paragraph
Paragraphs are separated by blank lines

tips.summary: Jump by sentences with ( and )
tips.details:
( previous sentence ) next sentence
Useful for prose editing

tips.summary: Find a character on the line with f/F
tips.details:
f{c} forward to char F{c} backward
Repeat with ; and reverse with ,

tips.summary: Find-till a character with t/T
tips.details:
t{c} forward stopping before char T{c} backward
Repeat with ; and ,

tips.summary: Use counts to speed up motions
tips.details:
Most motions accept a numeric prefix
Examples: 5j, 3w, 10G

tips.summary: Enter Insert mode with i and a
tips.details:
i inserts before cursor a inserts after cursor
Use Esc (or Ctrl-[) to return to Normal mode

tips.summary: Insert at start/end with I and A
tips.details:
I goes to first non-blank then inserts
A goes to end of line then inserts

tips.summary: Open lines with o and O
tips.details:
o opens below O opens above
Vim enters Insert mode automatically

tips.summary: Exit Insert mode with Esc or Ctrl-[
tips.details:
Ctrl-[ is the same as Esc
Often faster on keyboards where Esc is far

tips.summary: Delete a character with x and X
tips.details:
x deletes under cursor X deletes before cursor
Counts work: 5x

tips.summary: Delete the current line with dd
tips.details:
dd deletes the whole line
3dd deletes three lines

tips.summary: Delete word-ish text with dw and de
tips.details:
dw deletes to next word start
de deletes to end of word
Try both to feel the difference

tips.summary: Delete a whole word with daw
tips.details:
daw deletes the word plus surrounding whitespace
Great for editing lists and arguments

tips.summary: Change a word with ciw
tips.details:
ciw changes the inner word (deletes it and enters Insert mode)
Then press . to repeat on another word

tips.summary: Change to end of line with C
tips.details:
C deletes from cursor to end of line and enters Insert mode
Equivalent to c$

tips.summary: Delete to end of line with D
tips.details:
D deletes from cursor to end of line
Equivalent to d$

tips.summary: Change the whole line with cc (or S)
tips.details:
cc changes the whole line
S is a shortcut for cc

tips.summary: Replace one character with r{c}
tips.details:
r{c} replaces the character under cursor
Stays in Normal mode

tips.summary: Replace multiple characters with R
tips.details:
R enters Replace mode (type over text)
Esc leaves Replace mode

tips.summary: Join lines with J
tips.details:
J joins the current line with the next line (adds a space)
Useful for unwrapping text

tips.summary: Join lines without extra space with gJ
tips.details:
gJ joins current line with next without inserting a space
Useful for code concatenation

tips.summary: Repeat the last change with .
tips.details:
. repeats your last edit
Combine with a motion for huge speedups

tips.summary: Undo and redo with u and Ctrl-r
tips.details:
u undo Ctrl-r redo
Undo is per change, not per keystroke

tips.summary: Yank (copy) a line with yy
tips.details:
yy yanks the whole line
3yy yanks three lines

tips.summary: Paste with p and P
tips.details:
p pastes after cursor/line P before
After dd, p puts the line back below

tips.summary: Search with / and ?
tips.details:
/pattern searches forward ?pattern backward
Use n for next match and N for previous

tips.summary: Search the word under cursor with * and #
tips.details:
* searches forward for whole word
# searches backward
Use g* / g# for partial matches

tips.summary: Clear search highlighting with :noh
tips.details:
:noh clears highlight (the pattern remains)
Good to bind to a key if you use it often

tips.summary: Enter Visual mode with v and V
tips.details:
v selects characters V selects whole lines
Then run d/y/>/< on the selection

tips.summary: Use Visual Block mode with Ctrl-v
tips.details:
Ctrl-v selects a rectangular block
Great for editing columns

tips.summary: Indent/outdent a selection with > and <
tips.details:
In Visual mode: > shifts right < shifts left
Use . to repeat the last shift

tips.summary: Reselect the last Visual selection with gv
tips.details:
gv reselects your previous Visual area
Useful for applying multiple actions

tips.summary: Jump to matching pairs with %
tips.details:
On (), {}, [], press % to jump to the match
(Keyword matching needs matchit plugin)

tips.summary: Center the cursor line with zz
tips.details:
zz scrolls so the cursor line is centered
Great after big jumps

tips.summary: Scroll so cursor is at top/bottom with zt/zb
tips.details:
zt places cursor line at top zb at bottom
Use when reading context

tips.summary: Move to first non-blank on next/prev line with + and -
tips.details:
+ moves to first non-blank next line
- moves to first non-blank previous line

tips.summary: Go to a specific screen column with |
tips.details:
80| goes to column 80
Helpful for checking line length

tips.summary: Toggle case of character(s) with ~
tips.details:
~ toggles case under cursor
Counts work: 5~ toggles 5 chars

tips.summary: Show file info with Ctrl-g
tips.details:
Displays file name, line/col, and percent through file
Good quick orientation

tips.summary: Write file with :w
tips.details:
:w saves current buffer
Use :w {path} to write to a new file

tips.summary: Quit with :q (and force with :q!)
tips.details:
:q quits if no changes
:q! discards changes and quits

tips.summary: Save and quit with :wq or :x
tips.details:
:wq always writes
:x writes only if the buffer changed

tips.summary: Save and quit quickly with ZZ
tips.details:
ZZ exits and writes the file if it was modified
If unmodified, it just exits

tips.summary: Open or reload a file with :e and :e!
tips.details:
:e {file} opens
:e! reloads from disk (drops local changes)

tips.summary: Read a file into the buffer with :r
tips.details:
:r {file} inserts the file below the cursor
Useful for templates/snippets

tips.summary: Insert shell command output with :r !cmd
tips.details:
:r !date inserts the output of date below cursor
Good for quick stamps

tips.summary: Use built-in help with :help
tips.details:
:help {topic} opens docs (try :help motion.txt)
Ctrl-] follows a help link; Ctrl-o goes back

tips.summary: Use Tab completion on : commands (wildmenu)
tips.details:
Tab completes commands/paths
For a nicer UI, enable :set wildmenu (and wildmode)

tips.summary: Print character info with ga
tips.details:
ga shows info/codepoint for char under cursor
Helpful for debugging weird characters

tips.summary: Use text objects: iw and aw
tips.details:
ciw changes inner word
daw deletes around word (incl. space)

tips.summary: Use text objects: i" and a"
tips.details:
ci" changes inside quotes
da" deletes including quotes

tips.summary: Use text objects: i' and a'
tips.details:
ci' changes inside single quotes
va' selects including quotes

tips.summary: Use text objects: i( a( i{ a{ i[ a[
tips.details:
Operate inside/around pairs: di{, ci(, va[
Great for refactoring arguments/blocks

tips.summary: Use tag text objects: it and at
tips.details:
In HTML/XML: cit changes inside a tag
dat deletes the tag and its contents

tips.summary: Paragraph objects: ip and ap
tips.details:
vip selects a paragraph
dap deletes paragraph including surrounding blank lines

tips.summary: Sentence objects: is and as
tips.details:
cis changes a sentence
das deletes the sentence (incl. punctuation)

tips.summary: Use operators with motions (the core Vim idea)
tips.details:
d + motion deletes, c + motion changes, y + motion yanks
Examples: d$, cW, yip

tips.summary: Upper/lowercase with gU/gu + motion
tips.details:
gUw uppercases a word
guip lowercases a paragraph

tips.summary: Toggle case with g~ + motion
tips.details:
g~iw toggles case for the word under cursor
Great for quick style fixes

tips.summary: Swap two characters with xp
tips.details:
x deletes current char, p pastes it after
Quick fix for adjacent typos

tips.summary: Jump to previous/next occurrence of the current word with * then n/N
tips.details:
* sets the search to the word under cursor
Use n/N to hop matches

tips.summary: Select next match with gn, then edit with cgn
tips.details:
After /search: gn selects next match
cgn changes it, then you can press n and . to repeat

tips.summary: Repeat your last :substitute with &
tips.details:
& repeats the last :s on the current line
:%& repeats it over the whole file

tips.summary: Repeat the last substitution with :&& (keeps flags)
tips.details:
:&& repeats the last :substitute and preserves flags like g/c
Useful after a confirmed substitution

tips.summary: Use very-magic regex with \v
tips.details:
\v makes most characters magic so you escape less
Example: :%s/\v(foo|bar)/baz/g

tips.summary: Match whole words with \< and \>
tips.details:
:%s/\<foo\>/bar/g replaces whole-word foo
Prevents partial replacements

tips.summary: Use confirmation in substitutions with the c flag
tips.details:
:%s/old/new/gc prompts on each match
Safer for big edits

tips.summary: Use the black-hole register to avoid clobbering yanks
tips.details:
"_d deletes without overwriting what you yanked
Great when pasting the same thing repeatedly

tips.summary: Inspect registers with :reg
tips.details:
:reg shows register contents (yanks, deletes, macros)
Helps you paste intentionally

tips.summary: Paste from a specific register with "{reg}p
tips.details:
"ap pastes from register a
"0p pastes the last yank (register 0)

tips.summary: Use the system clipboard with "+ (when available)
tips.details:
"+y copies to OS clipboard
"+p pastes from it
Requires clipboard support/provider

tips.summary: Jump to where Insert mode last ended with `^
tips.details:
`^ goes to the position where you last exited Insert mode
Use gi to also re-enter Insert mode

tips.summary: Return to last insert location and enter Insert with gi
tips.details:
gi jumps to the last insertion point and enters Insert mode
Great after navigating around

tips.summary: Navigate the change list with g; and g,
tips.details:
g; jumps to an older change location
g, jumps forward to a newer change

tips.summary: List change locations with :changes
tips.details:
:changes shows the change list for the buffer
Pairs well with g; and g,

tips.summary: Use marks: m{a}, then 'a or `a
tips.details:
ma sets mark a
'a jumps to the line; `a jumps to exact column

tips.summary: Use global marks with uppercase letters
tips.details:
mA sets a global mark
'A jumps there even from another file

tips.summary: See marks with :marks
tips.details:
:marks lists marks in the current buffer
Useful when juggling multiple points

tips.summary: Jump list navigation with Ctrl-o and Ctrl-i
tips.details:
Ctrl-o goes back in jump history
Ctrl-i goes forward

tips.summary: Reindent current line with ==
tips.details:
== applies indentation rules for the filetype
Good after editing braces

tips.summary: Reindent a paragraph with =ip
tips.details:
=ip reindents the current paragraph/block
Useful after pasting code

tips.summary: Reindent whole file with gg=G
tips.details:
gg=G reindents the entire buffer
Use carefully (depends on filetype indent rules)

tips.summary: Format text with gq{motion}
tips.details:
gqap formats a paragraph using textwidth/formatoptions
Great for comments and prose

tips.summary: Format (wrap) without changing as much with gw{motion}
tips.details:
gw can be a gentler wrapper depending on settings
Try gwap on a paragraph

tips.summary: Enable spelling with :set spell
tips.details:
:set spell turns on spellcheck
Use ]s/[s to jump misspellings

tips.summary: Fix spelling with z=
tips.details:
z= shows suggestions for the word under cursor
Choose a number to replace

tips.summary: Add word to dictionary with zg
tips.details:
zg marks the word as good (adds to spellfile)
zw marks as wrong

tips.summary: Split windows with :split and :vsplit
tips.details:
:split horizontal :vsplit vertical
Then move with Ctrl-w h/j/k/l

tips.summary: Move between windows with Ctrl-w h/j/k/l
tips.details:
Ctrl-w then direction moves focus
Ctrl-w w cycles windows

tips.summary: Close a window with :close
tips.details:
Closes the current split window
Does not necessarily wipe the buffer

tips.summary: Keep only one window with :only
tips.details:
Closes other windows but keeps buffers loaded
Nice for focus

tips.summary: Equalize splits with Ctrl-w =
tips.details:
Makes all windows the same size
Great after lots of resizing

tips.summary: Resize windows with Ctrl-w + / - / < / >
tips.details:
Ctrl-w + and Ctrl-w - change height
Ctrl-w < and Ctrl-w > change width

tips.summary: Use tabs with :tabnew, gt, and gT
tips.details:
:tabnew opens a new tab page
gt next tab gT previous tab

tips.summary: List buffers with :ls (or :buffers)
tips.details:
Shows buffer numbers and status
Use :b {N} to jump to one

tips.summary: Navigate buffers with :bnext and :bprev
tips.details:
:bnext and :bprev cycle buffers
:b# switches to alternate buffer

tips.summary: Close a buffer with :bd
tips.details:
:bd deletes the buffer (unloads file)
Your window stays open (usually shows another buffer)

tips.summary: Write all modified buffers with :wa
tips.details:
:wa writes all changed buffers
Good before running builds/tests

tips.summary: Run a shell command with :!cmd
tips.details:
:!make or :!ls runs an external command
Press Enter to return to Vim

tips.summary: Filter text through a shell command with !{motion}
tips.details:
!{motion}{cmd} pipes text through cmd
Example: !!sort filters the current line through sort
Example: !ipfmt formats a paragraph via fmt

tips.summary: Insert a register in Insert mode with Ctrl-r
tips.details:
In Insert mode: Ctrl-r {reg} inserts register contents
Example: Ctrl-r % inserts current filename

tips.summary: Complete words in Insert mode with Ctrl-n/Ctrl-p
tips.details:
Ctrl-n next completion Ctrl-p previous
Works with words found in current buffers

tips.summary: Toggle line numbers with :set number
tips.details:
:set number shows absolute line numbers
:set nonumber hides them

tips.summary: Use relative numbers with :set relativenumber
tips.details:
Shows distances from cursor line
Great for motions like 5j/7k

tips.summary: Show whitespace with :set list
tips.details:
:set list reveals tabs/trailing spaces (configured by listchars)
:set nolist hides it

tips.summary: Strip trailing whitespace with a safe substitute
tips.details:
:%s/\s\+$//e removes trailing spaces
The e flag suppresses errors if no match

tips.summary: Use :set hlsearch and :set incsearch
tips.details:
hlsearch highlights matches
incsearch shows matches while typing /pattern

tips.summary: Record a macro with q{reg} and stop with q
tips.details:
qa starts recording into register a
Press q again to stop

tips.summary: Replay a macro with @{reg}
tips.details:
@a runs macro a once
10@a runs it ten times

tips.summary: Repeat the last executed macro with @@
tips.details:
@@ replays the most recent macro
Great when stepping line-by-line

tips.summary: Append to a macro with qA
tips.details:
qA appends new keystrokes to macro register a
Useful for refining without re-recording

tips.summary: Run a macro on selected lines with :normal @a
tips.details:
Visual-select lines, then :normal @a
Applies the macro to each selected line

tips.summary: Run a Normal command across a range with :normal
tips.details:
Example: :'<,'>normal! I// adds // at start of each selected line
Use :normal! to ignore mappings

tips.summary: Target matching lines with :global
tips.details:
:g/pat/d deletes matching lines
:g/pat/normal! {cmd} runs Normal keys on matches

tips.summary: Target non-matching lines with :vglobal
tips.details:
:v/pat/d deletes lines that do NOT match the pattern
Useful for filtering lists

tips.summary: Project edits across args list with :argdo
tips.details:
Build args (e.g., :args **/*.py) then :argdo %s/old/new/ge | update
Controlled multi-file changes

tips.summary: Run commands across loaded buffers with :bufdo
tips.details:
:bufdo %s/old/new/ge | update applies per buffer
Be careful: it touches everything loaded

tips.summary: Run a command in every window with :windo
tips.details:
:windo set number applies to all windows
Great for window-local options

tips.summary: Run a command in every tab page with :tabdo
tips.details:
:tabdo windo set cursorline applies across tabs
Useful for layout-wide changes

tips.summary: Populate quickfix with :vimgrep
tips.details:
:vimgrep /pattern/ **/* fills the quickfix list
Then :copen and :cnext to jump matches

tips.summary: Open/close quickfix with :copen and :cclose
tips.details:
:copen shows results/errors
:cclose closes the quickfix window

tips.summary: Navigate quickfix with :cnext/:cprev
tips.details:
:cnext jumps to next item
:cprev jumps to previous item

tips.summary: Jump to first/last quickfix item with :cfirst/:clast
tips.details:
:cfirst goes to first entry
:clast goes to last entry

tips.summary: Apply an Ex command per quickfix entry with :cdo
tips.details:
:cdo {cmd} runs {cmd} for each quickfix item
Often paired with | update to save changes

tips.summary: Use location list for window-local results
tips.details:
:lopen opens the location list
Use :lnext/:lprev to navigate

tips.summary: Run a command per location entry with :ldo
tips.details:
:ldo {cmd} runs {cmd} for each location list item
Like :cdo but per-window

tips.summary: Edit command history in the command-line window with q:
tips.details:
q: opens a buffer-like window for past :commands
Edit, then press Enter to run

tips.summary: Edit search history with q/
tips.details:
q/ opens search history
Useful for fixing long regex searches

tips.summary: Open command-line window while typing : with Ctrl-f
tips.details:
While entering a :command, press Ctrl-f to edit it in a window
(You can return with Enter)

tips.summary: Repeat the last Ex command with @:
tips.details:
@: re-runs the last :command
Good for repeating a substitution or write command

tips.summary: Use :execute to build dynamic commands
tips.details:
:execute 'normal! ' . 'gg=G' builds and runs a command string
Useful in scripts and mappings

tips.summary: Use :normal! to ignore mappings
tips.details:
:normal! runs raw keystrokes
Helps make macros/scripts predictable

tips.summary: Silence noisy commands with :silent
tips.details:
:silent %s/old/new/g reduces output
Great in batch operations

tips.summary: Preserve your jump list with :keepjumps
tips.details:
:keepjumps {cmd} runs without adding to jump list
Nice for big automated edits

tips.summary: Preserve your search pattern with :keeppatterns
tips.details:
:keeppatterns {cmd} avoids overwriting your last / search
Helpful in scripts

tips.summary: Use persistent undo with :set undofile
tips.details:
Keeps undo history across restarts
Also set an undodir path in config

tips.summary: Time-travel undo with :earlier and :later
tips.details:
:earlier 10m goes to the state 10 minutes ago
:later 5m moves forward again

tips.summary: Use :set paste when pasting problematic text
tips.details:
:set paste disables autoindent side-effects while pasting
Remember :set nopaste afterwards

tips.summary: Increment/decrement numbers with Ctrl-a/Ctrl-x
tips.details:
Ctrl-a increments number under cursor
Ctrl-x decrements
Counts work: 10 Ctrl-a

tips.summary: Create folds with zf{motion}
tips.details:
zfip folds a paragraph
Folds help manage large files

tips.summary: Open/close folds with zo/zc and toggle with za
tips.details:
zo open fold zc close fold za toggle
Use zR/zM to open/close all

tips.summary: Open all / close all folds with zR and zM
tips.details:
zR opens all folds
zM closes all folds

tips.summary: Enable syntax folds with :set foldmethod=syntax
tips.details:
Uses syntax rules to create folds
Depends on filetype/syntax support

tips.summary: Save and restore a session with :mksession
tips.details:
:mksession! Session.vim saves layout
:source Session.vim restores tabs/windows/buffers

tips.summary: Save/restore views (cursor/folds) with :mkview/:loadview
tips.details:
:mkview stores view data
:loadview restores it for the file

tips.summary: Run external grep into quickfix with :grep (config-dependent)
tips.details:
:grep uses 'grepprg' (often set to grep/rg)
After :grep, use :copen and :cnext

tips.summary: Use :make to fill quickfix with build errors
tips.details:
:make runs makeprg and populates quickfix
Then :cnext to jump errors

tips.summary: Customize builds with :set makeprg
tips.details:
Example: :set makeprg=pytest\ -q
Then :make runs that command

tips.summary: Diff files with :diffsplit
tips.details:
:diffsplit {file} opens a diff view
Use ]c/[c to jump changes

tips.summary: Jump between diff hunks with ]c and [c
tips.details:
]c next diff chunk [c previous
Works in diff mode

tips.summary: Use diffget/diffput with do and dp
tips.details:
do = diffget (take other side)
dp = diffput (push to other side)
In diff mode only

tips.summary: Create Insert-mode abbreviations with :iabbrev
tips.details:
:iabbrev teh the fixes a common typo while typing
Abbreviations expand in Insert mode

tips.summary: Create safe mappings with :nnoremap
tips.details:
Prefer noremap variants to avoid recursive mappings
Example: :nnoremap <leader>w :w<CR>

tips.summary: Use a leader key for custom shortcuts
tips.details:
Set mapleader (often space)
Then map <leader> combos to frequent actions

tips.summary: Show invisible characters via listchars
tips.details:
Configure listchars and toggle with :set list
Helps spot tabs and trailing spaces

tips.summary: Use :set formatoptions to control comment wrapping
tips.details:
formatoptions influences gq behavior and auto-commenting
Tune it per filetype if needed

tips.summary: Use K to open keyword help (man/keywordprg)
tips.details:
K runs 'keywordprg' on word under cursor (often man)
Depends on filetype and environment
